measurableElement.name: Staff adheres to standard personal protection practices
Facility ensures adequate personal protection equipment as per requirements
Facility ensures standard practices for maintaining asepsis
Staff is trained and adhere to standard hand washing practices
Hand washing facilities are provided at point of use
The facility ensures standard practices and materials for disinfection and sterilization of instruments and equipment
The facility ensures standard practices and materials for decontamination and cleaning of instruments and procedures areas
The facility has established internal quality assurance programme
Quality objectives have been defined, and the objectives are reviewed and monitored periodically
Corrective and Preventive actions are taken to address the issues observed in the assessment and audit
The facility conducts the periodic prescription/ medical audits
The facility ensures that non compliances are enumerated and recorded adequately
The facility has established external assurance programmes
The facility has a quality team in place
The facility reviews quality of its services at periodic intervals
The facility has defined quality policy and it has been disseminated
Action plan is made on gaps found in the assessment/audit process
Patient Satisfaction surveys are conducted at periodic intervals
Facility prepares the action plans for the areas of low satisfaction
Employee satisfaction Surveys are conducted at periodic intervals
Work instructions are displayed at Point of work
Staff is trained as per SOPs
Standard Operating procedures are prepared , distributed and implemented for all key processes
The facility uses methods and tools for Quality Improvement
Facility measures Clinical Care & Safety Indicators on monthly basis
Facility measures efficiency Indicators on monthly basis
Facility measures Service Quality Indicators on monthly basis
Facility measures Productivity Indicators on monthly basis
The facility strives to improve indicators from its current performance
No thoroughfare / general traffic in hospital premises
No water logging in open areas
Open areas are well maintained
There is no unauthorised occupation within the facility, nor there is encroachment on Hospital land
There is no abandoned / dilapidated building within the premises
There is a system of periodical inspection for water wastage
Hospital has a functional rain water harvesting system
Water supply is adequate in Quantity & Quality
Water supply system is maintained in the Hospital
Hospital promotes water conservation
Staff periodically sort useful and unnecessary articles at work station
The Staff arrange the useful articles, records in systematic manner
Staff label the articles in identifiable manner
Staff has been trained for work place management
Work stations are clean and free of dirt/dust
Internal Roads, Pathways, waiting area, etc. are uneven and clean
Green Areas/ Parks/ Open spaces are well maintained

Gardens/ green area are secured with fence
Provision of Herbal Garden
Walls are well-plastered and painted
No unwanted/Outdated posters
Interior of patient care areas are plastered & painted
Uniform signage system in the Hospital
Name of the hospital is prominently displayed at the entrance
Measures for Mosquito free environment are in place
Cattle-trap is installed at the entrance
No stray animals within the facility premises
Pest Control Measures are implemented in the facility
Anti-termite Treatment of the wooden furniture and fixtures is undertaken periodically
Hospital has adequate facility for parking of vehicles
Hospital has a system for periodic maintenance of infrastructure at pre-defined interval
Hospital has intact boundary wall and functional gates at entry
Hospital Infrastructure is well maintained
Electric wiring and Fittings are maintained
Adequate illumination in Procedure Areas (Labour Room/ OT)
Use of energy efficient bulbs
Adequate illumination in Circulation Area
Adequate illumination in front of hospital and access road
Adequate illumination in Indoor Areas
There is a system of preventive maintenance of furniture and fixtures
Window and doors are maintained
Furniture at the nursing station, staff room, administrative office are maintained
Patient Beds & Mattresses are in good condition
Trolleys, Stretchers, Wheel Chairs, etc. are well maintained
No junk material in critical service area
No junk material in Open Areas and corridors
Hospital has demarcated space for keeping condemned junk material
Hospital has documented and implemented Condemnation policy
No junk material in patient care areas
No Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust on walls and roofs of corridors
Corridors are cleaned at least twice in the day with wet mop
Corridors are rigorously cleaned with scrubbing / flooding once in a month
No dirt/Grease/Stains in the Circulation area
Surfaces are conducive of effective cleaning
Floors, walls, furniture and fixture are thoroughly cleaned once in a month
No dirt/Grease/ Stains/ Garbage in Auxiliary Area
No Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Seepage on walls and roofs of Auxiliary Area
Furniture & Fixtures are without grease and dust and cleaned daily
Auxiliary Areas are cleaned at least twice in the day with wet mop
Use of Three bucket system for cleaning
Use of separate mops for critical and semi critical areas and procedures surfaces
Disinfection and washing of mops after every cleaning cycle
Use unidirectional method and out word mopping
No use of brooms in patient care areas
All the drains are cleaned once in a week
Gradient of Drains is conducive for adequate for maintaining flow
No blocked/ over-flowing drains in the facility
Availability of connection with Municipal Sewage System/ or Soak Pit
Availability of closed drainage system
No dirt/Grease/ Stains/ Garbage in wards
Wards are cleaned at least thrice in the day with wet mop
Floors, walls, furniture and fixture are thoroughly cleaned once in a week.
No Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust/Seepage on walls and roofs of wards
Patient Furniture, Mattresses, Fixtures are without grease and dust
Floors, walls, furniture and fixture are thoroughly cleaned once in a week.
OT/Labour Room floors and procedures surfaces are cleaned at least twice a day / after every surgery
No dirt/Grease/ Stains/ Garbage in Procedure Areas
No Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Seepage in OT & Labour Room
OT & Labour Room Tables are without grease, body fluid and dust
Use of Housekeeping Checklist in Toilets
Use of Housekeeping Checklist in Patient Care Areas
A person is designated for monitoring of Housekeeping Activities
Monitoring of adequacy and quality of material used for cleaning
Use of Housekeeping Checklist in Procedure Areas
Toilets have running water and functional cistern
Floors of Toilets are Dry
No foul smell in the Toilets
No dirt/Grease/Stains/ Garbage in Toilets
Sinks and Cistern are cleaned every two hours or whenever required
Availability of Detergent Disinfectant solution / Hospital Grade Phenyl for Cleaning purpose
Availability of carbolic Acid/ Bacilocid for surface cleaning in procedure areas- OT, Labour Room
Availability of Buckets and carts for Mopping
Availability of Cleaning Equipment
Cleaning staff uses correct concentration of cleaning solution

Ambulatory Areas are cleaned at least thrice in the day with wet mop
No dirt/Grease/Stains / Garbage in Ambulatory Area
Floors, walls, furniture and fixture are thoroughly cleaned once in a week.
Furniture, & Fixtures are without grease and dust and cleaned daily
Recyclable and Biodegradable Wastes have segregated collection
The Facility Undertakes efforts to educate patients and visitors about segregation of recyclable and biodegradable wastes
Availability of Compost Pit within the premises
General Waste is not mixed with infected waste
The facility has introduced innovations in managing General Waste
The facility has started undertaking actions, which are to be complied by March 2018
The facility has implemented Biomedical Waste Rules
An existing committee or newly constituted committee for review and monitoring of BMW management at DH/CHC level
The Hospital leadership is aware of Biomedical Waste Rules 2016 including key changes in the rule vis~a~vis Biomedical Waste Rule 1998.
The facility has started undertaking actions, which are to be complied by March 2017
Disinfected Glassware is stored as per protocol given in Schedule I of the BMW Rules 2016
Sharp Waste is stored in Puncture proof containers
Disinfection of Broken / Discarded Glassware is done as per recommended procedure
The Staff uses needle cutters for cutting/burning the syringe hub
Discarded / contaminated linen is disposed as per procedure given in the BMW Rules 2016
The Health Facility has adequate arrangements for disposal of Biomedical waste
Deep Burial Pit is constructed as per norms given in the Biomedical Waste Rules 2016
Disposal of Expired or discarded medicine is done as per protocol given in Schedule I of BMW Rules 2016
Recyclable waste is disposed as per procedure given in the BMW Rules 2016
Availability of Bins and liners for segregated collection of waste at point of use
Availability of Needle/ Hub cutter and puncture proof boxes
Availability of Sodium Hypochlorite Solution
Availability of trolleys for waste collection and transportation
Availability and supply of personal protective equipment
Availability of Mercury Spill Management Kit
The Staff is aware of Mercury Spill management
Disposal of Disinfectant solution like Glutaraldehyde
Disposal of Radiographic Developer and Fixer
Runoff is drained into the municipal drain
Sullage is managed scientifically
The laboratory has a functional protocol for managing discarded samples
Body fluids, Secretions in suction apparatus, blood and other exudates in OT, Labour room, minor OT, Dressing room are disposed only after treatment
The Facility has treatment facility for managing infectious liquid waste
Segregation of BMW is done as per BMW management rule,2016
Biomedical waste bins are covered
Work instructions for segregation and handling of Biomedical waste has been displayed prominently
The facility has linkage with a CWTF Operator or has deep burial pit (with prior approval of the prescribed authority)
Transportation of biomedical waste is done in closed container/trolley
Dedicated Storage facility is available for biomedical waste and its has biohazard symbol displayed
No Biomedical waste is stored for more than 48 Hours
The Storage facility is secured against pilferage and reach of animal and rodents.
The Storage facility is located away from the patient area and has connectivity of a motorable road.
The storage facility has hand-washing facilities for the workers
The Health facility maintains its website and annual report is uploaded
The Health Facility has a system of review and monitoring of BMW Management through an existing committee or by forming a new committee
The Health Facility has a valid authorization for Bio Medical waste Management from the prescribed authority
The Health Facility maintains records, as required under the Biomedical Waste Rules 2016
The Health Facility submits Annual report to pollution control board
Regular microbiological surveillance of Critical areas
Hospital measures Surgical Site Infection Rates
Hospital measures Device Related HAI rates
Hospital takes corrective Action on occurrence of HAIs
Hospital measures Blood Related and Respiratory Tract HAI
Maintenance of air exchanges in OT and ICU
Maintenance of positive air pressure in OT and ICU
Carbolization of OT and Labour Room
Maintenance of Layout in OT
General and patient traffic are segregated in Hospitals
Correct method of wearing and removing gloves
Correct Method of wearing mask and cap
The Staff is aware of Standard Precautions
The staff is aware of use of gloves, when to use (occasion) and its type
No re-use of disposable personal protective equipment
Sterility of autoclaved pack maintained during storage
Adherence to Protocols for autoclaving
Chemical Sterilization of instruments done as per protocol
Adherence to Protocol for High Level disinfection
Use of Signal Locks for sterilization
Availability of spill management Kit
Staff is aware of management of large spills
